workout_title: Lower Body Sculpt: Glutes, Hamstrings, and Quads

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Perform squats with a controlled motion, focusing on depth and form. Complete 2 sets of 10 reps.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand next to a wall for support.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing one leg forward and backward, then side to side. Repeat with the other leg. Complete 1 set of 10 swings per leg.
Rotate your hips in a circular motion, first clockwise, then counterclockwise. Complete 1 set of 10 circles each direction.

exercises.setup: Position the barbell on your upper traps. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
execution: 1. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Unrack the bar and step back, positioning feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Keep your chest up and core engaged.
4. Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight.
5. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
6. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, typically around 70-75% of your one-rep max (1RM).
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Position yourself on the hack squat machine with your back against the pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
2. Lower the weight by bending your knees and hips.
3. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, typically around 70-75% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a stable posture and avoid letting your knees cave inward during the squat.

exercises.setup: Start with the bar on the ground. Pick it up like a regular deadlift for the first rep.
execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your chest up and shoulders back.
3. Push your hips back while keeping a slight bend in your knees.
4. Lower the bar along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, typically around 65-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell or dumbbells.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Keep your legs straight but not locked.
2. Lower the weight by bending at the hips.
3. Return to the starting position by engaging your hamstrings and glutes.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8-10 reps with good form, typically around 65-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a flat back throughout the movement to avoid lower back strain.

exercises.setup: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell over your hips.
execution: 1. Roll the barbell over your hips and position your feet flat on the ground.
2. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until they are fully extended.
3. Keep a neutral pelvis and squeeze your glutes at the top.
4. Lower your hips back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 70-75% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Position yourself with your upper back against a bench and one foot flat on the ground.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Drive through your heel to lift your hips.
3. Lower your hips back to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 70-75% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement for maximum activation.

exercises.setup: Use a GHR machine or set up on a lat pull-down machine with a counterbalance.
execution: 1. Position yourself on the GHR machine with your feet secured.
2. Lower your body by bending at the knees.
3. Return to the starting position by engaging your hamstrings.
exercises.weight: Bodyweight or add resistance if needed to complete 8-10 reps with good form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Secure your feet under a stable surface or use a partner for support.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Lower your body slowly by extending your knees.
2. Return to the starting position by engaging your hamstrings.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use bodyweight or add resistance if needed to complete 8-10 reps with good form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlling the negative portion of the movement to maximize muscle engagement.
